definition: corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: We should try to clear graft, waste and inefficiency out of government.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该尽力消除政府中的贪赃枉法。

sentences.english: It is hoped that the new laws will scotch the snake of dishonesty among members of the government.
sentences.chinese: 大家希望新法律能打击政府人员贪赃枉法。

definition: to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
